page.title: 18A TYPICAL SUNDAY 1985
page.content: I've woken up and it's a typical Summer Sunday. It is raining. Well at least I've got a cooked breakfast: Eggs, Bacon, Sausage, Fried Bread and Toast. After the meal I've got to go and get washed then I sit down and read the Sunday papers, we have the Sunday Mail and the Sunday People . In today's papers there is nothing much except the usual terrorists and murders . We only have a light lunch and after that we go out for a walk somewhere. We end up at Oulton Broad feeding the ducks and the swans who prefer hands. When we get back I decide to have a "bash" on Hypersports on my 48K ZX SPECTRUM. I soon "notch" up my highest score "99 048". Then my brother came in and I then let him have a go . At 9'0'clock I go to bed dreading some of the lessons to come in the forthcoming week.
